texts.name: Divine Hierarchy Token
texts.desc:
Your opponent cannot Tribute this card.
 Control of this card cannot switch.
 Unaffected by Spell/Trap effects that would make this card leave the field.
 Unaffected by other monsters' effects, except for monsters with the same or higher Divine Hierarchy.
 This card cannot be destroyed by battle with a monster with lower Divine Hierarchy, also the controller of this card takes no battle damage from that battle.
 If this card was Special Summoned, return it to the location it was Special Summoned from during the End Phase.
 Other cards' effects are only applied on this card for 1 turn.

texts.name: Boss Duel
texts.desc:
At the start of the Duel, banish this card.
 Your LP becomes your starting LP x the number of your opponents.
 Remove all non-Boss Cards you own at the start of the Duel.
 At start of the Duel, return all cards in your hand to the Deck and draw the same number of cards marked Start.
 Your Deck is always arranged in the following order of marked cards:
Start=> 1=> 2=> 3
 During Standy Phase, add all cards from the Graveyard to your hand.
 You can Normal Summon any number of times.
 You cannot lose the duel due to being unable to draw
 Your cards cannot be banished, if they would be banished, destroy them instead.
 Before your opponent starts their turn, they can apply 1 of the following effects, each effect can be used once per Duel:
1. During the Battle Phase of this turn, double the ATK of all monsters you control
2. Instead of conducting your normal draw this turn, you can add 1 card from your Deck to your hand.
3. Choose 1 player, that player gains LP equal to half of the starting LP.
 If your opponent would win the Duel by an Alternate Win Condition, you take damage equal to the starting LP instead.
texts.str2: During the Battle Phase, double the ATK of all monsters you control
texts.str3: Add 1 card from your Deck to your hand, instead of your normal draw
texts.str4: Choose 1 player, that player gains LP equal to half of the starting LP

texts.name: Darkness/Monster A
texts.desc:
You can target 1 monster you control; give control of that target to 1 opponent player, then Special Summon 1 monster from 1 opponent player's Deck to your side of the field, ignoring its Summoning conditions.

-I Summon "Darkness Outsider"!-

texts.name: Darkness/Monster B
texts.desc:
Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. When a monster declares an attack: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. Once per turn: You can choose 1 player; make that player's LP 4000. Once per turn: You can return all Spells/Traps on the field to the hand.

-I Summon "Darkness Neosphere"!-

texts.name: Darkness/Spell A
texts.desc:
Once per turn, this card cannot be destroyed by card effects. When this card is activated: Set 1 "Darkness/Trap A", "Darkness/Trap B", "Darkness/Trap C", "Darkness/Trap D" and "Darkness/Trap E" directly from your hand or Deck. The activation and effect of Continuous Traps you control cannot be negated.

-I activate "Darkness"!-

Hidden Effect
Once per turn: You can return all other Spells/Traps on the field to the hand.

texts.name: Darkness/Trap B
texts.desc:
Activate only by the effect of "Darkness/Trap A". Your opponent cannot activate Spells/Traps in response to this card's activation. If you control "Darkness/Trap A", apply the following effect.
 Activate the first effect of all Set "Darkness/Trap C", "Darkness/Trap D" and "Darkness/Trap E" in your Spell & Trap Zones in any order.

-I activate "Infinity"!-

texts.name: Darkness/Trap A
texts.desc:
Activate this card by targeting 1 Set "Darkness/Trap B" in your Spell & Trap Zones; force its activation. Your opponent cannot activate Spells/Traps in response to this card's activation.

-I activate "Zero"!-

texts.name: Darkness/Trap C
texts.desc:
Activate only by the effect of "Darkness/Trap B". When you activate this card: You can banish 1 card your opponent controls. Each time another "Darkness" Continuous Trap is activated, you can banish 1 card your opponent controls.

-I activate "Darkness 1"!-

texts.name: Darkness/Trap D
texts.desc:
Activate only by the effect of "Darkness/Trap B". When this card is activated: 1 monster you control gains 4000 ATK. Each time another "Darkness" Continuous Trap is activated, 1 monster you control gains 4000 ATK.

-I activate "Darkness 2"!-

texts.name: Darkness/Trap E
texts.desc:
Activate only by the effect of "Darkness/Trap B". When this card is activated: Inflict 2000 damage to 1 opponent player. Each time another "Darkness" Continuous Trap is activated, inflict 2000 damage to 1 opponent player.

-I activate "Darkness 3"!-

texts.name: Command Duel
texts.desc:
Remove this card from the Duel immediately, and if you do, if all cards you now own compose an invalid Deck, your opponent can make you lose the Duel. Otherwise, draw 1 card if this card was in your hand. If both players agree, apply the following rules.
 Activate a random Command Card at the start of each player's turn.

texts.name: Command Duel 1
texts.desc: Both players choose 1 card from their Decks, reveal it to their opponent and then add it to their hand.

texts.name: Command Duel 2
texts.desc: Both players choose 1 card from their Decks, and send it to the Graveyard.

texts.name: Command Duel 3
texts.desc: Both players reveal the top card of their Decks. If it's a monster, that card is added to the hand, otherwise, place it on top of the Deck.

texts.name: Command Duel 4
texts.desc: Both players randomly discards 1 card from their opponent's hand, then, draws 1 card.

texts.name: Command Duel 5
texts.desc: Both players adds the top card of their Graveyard to their hand.

texts.name: Command Duel 6
texts.desc: Both players chooses 1 card from their hand and places it at the bottom of the Deck, then, draw 2 cards.

texts.name: Command Duel 7
texts.desc: Both players can directly Set 1 Trap Card from their Deck onto the field.

texts.name: Command Duel 8
texts.desc: If both players have a Set card on the field, both players can destroy 1 Set card their opponent controls.

texts.name: Command Duel 9
texts.desc: Both players discard 1 card from their hand, and add 1 card from the Graveyard to their hand.

texts.name: Command Duel 10
texts.desc: Both players shuffle all cards in their hands into the Deck, then they draw an equal amount of cards.

texts.name: Command Duel 11
texts.desc: Both players play Rock-Paper-Scissors. The player who wins gains 2000 LP.

texts.name: Command Duel 12
texts.desc: Both players play Rock-Paper-Scissors. The player who wins Special Summons 1 monster from their Graveyard.

texts.name: Command Duel 13
texts.desc: Both players play Rock-Paper-Scissors. The player who wins draws 1 card.

texts.name: Command Duel 14
texts.desc: All monsters on the field are changed to face-down Defense Position. During this turn, monsters cannot change their battle positions.

texts.name: Command Duel 15
texts.desc: The player who has less LP than their opponent gains 2000 LP.

texts.name: Command Duel 16
texts.desc: Until the end of the turn, face-up FIRE and WATER monsters on the field have their original ATK doubled.

texts.name: Command Duel 17
texts.desc: Until the end of the turn, WATER and EARTH monsters on the field have their ATK/DEF switched.

texts.name: Command Duel 18
texts.desc: Until the end of the turn, face-up FIRE and WIND monsters on the field can attack twice during each Battle Phase.

texts.name: Command Duel 19
texts.desc: Until the end of the turn, face-up EARTH and WIND monsters on the field cannot be destroyed.

texts.name: Command Duel 20
texts.desc: Until the end of the turn, face-up LIGHT and DARK monsters cannot activate their effects.

texts.name: Command Duel 21
texts.desc: All currently face-up monsters have 0 ATK until the end of this turn.

texts.name: Command Duel 22
texts.desc: Detach all Xyz Materials from Xyz Monsters currently on the field.

texts.name: Command Duel 23
texts.desc: Return all Level 4 monsters face-up on the field to the hand.

texts.name: Command Duel 24
texts.desc:
Players can choose to wear their belt. Toss a coin, if Heads, players wearing a belt can apply this effect. If Tails, players not wearing a belt can apply this effect.
 You can change the Levels of all monsters you currently control, from 1 to 12.

texts.name: Command Duel 25
texts.desc: Players can choose to wear glasses. Toss a coin, if Heads, players wearing glasses gain 800 LP. If Tails, players not wearing glasses gain 800 LP.

texts.name: Command Duel JP1
texts.desc: Both players can Special Summon 1 monster from their Deck or Extra Deck that has "This card cannot be used in a Duel." written on it, ignoring their Summoning conditions.

texts.name: Command Duel JP2
texts.desc: Both players can Special Summon 1 monster from their Extra Deck that has "This card cannot be used in a Duel." written on it, ignoring their Summoning conditions, and if it does, that player(s) can draw 1 card.

texts.name: Chaos End Ruler - Ruler of the Beginning and the End
texts.desc: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must first be Special Summoned (from your hand) by banishing 1 LIGHT Warrior-Type and 1 DARK Fiend-Type monster from your Graveyard. When Special Summoned, cards and effects cannot be activated. You can pay 1000 LP; banish all cards in your opponent's hand, field, and Graveyard, then inflict 500 damage to your opponent for each card banished by this effect.

texts.name: Hand-Holding Genie (VG)
texts.desc: Your opponent cannot target other face-up monsters you control for an attack. Gains DEF equal to the the combined original DEF of all other Defense Position monsters you control.

texts.name: Sandaion, the Timelord (VG)
texts.desc: Cannot be Special Summoned from the Deck. If you control no monsters, you can Normal Summon this card without Tributing. Cannot be destroyed by battle or by card effects. Neither player takes any battle damage from attacks involving this Attack Position card. At the end of the Battle Phase, if this card attacked or was attacked: Inflict 2000 damage to your opponent. Once per turn, during your Standby Phase: Shuffle this face-up card into the Deck.
texts.str2: This card returns to the deck

texts.name: Hailon, the Timelord (VG)
texts.desc: Cannot be Special Summoned from the Deck. If you control no monsters, you can Normal Summon this card without Tributing. Cannot be destroyed by battle or by card effects. You take no battle damage from battles involving this Attack Position card. At the end of the Battle Phase, if this card attacked or was attacked, and your LP are lower than your opponent's: Inflict damage to your opponent equal to your current LP deficit. Once per turn, during your Standby Phase: Shuffle this face-up card into the Deck.
texts.str2: This card returns to the deck

During your Standby Phase: Shuffle this face-up card into the Deck.
texts.str2: This card returns to the deck

texts.str2: This card returns to the deck

texts.desc: Cannot be Special Summoned from the Deck. If you control no monsters, you can Normal Summon this card without Tributing. Cannot be destroyed by battle or by card effects. During your Standby Phase: Shuffle this face-up card into the Deck.
texts.str2: This card returns to the deck

texts.name: Lazion, the Timelord (VG)
texts.desc: Cannot be Special Summoned from the Deck. If you control no monsters, you can Normal Summon this card without Tributing. Cannot be destroyed by battle or by card effects. You take no battle damage from battles involving this Attack Position card. At the end of the Battle Phase, if this card attacked or was attacked: Return all cards in your opponent's Graveyard to the Deck. texts.str2: This card returns to the deck

texts.name: Time Maiden (VG)
texts.desc:
Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must first be Special Summoned (from your hand) if you control no monsters. You can Tribute this card; add 1 "Timelord" monster from your Deck to your hand.

(This card is always treated as a "Priestess" card.)

texts.name: Time Angel
texts.desc: When this face-up Attack Position card is destroyed by battle and sent to the Graveyard: Return all monsters on the field to the hand.

texts.name: Empty Machine (VG)
texts.desc: Once per turn: You can discard 1 "Timelord" monster; draw 1 card.
texts.str1: Activate the effect of "Zero Machine Ain"?

texts.name: Infinite Machine (VG)
texts.desc: Activate this card by sending 1 face-up "Empty Machine" from your Spell & Trap Zone to the Graveyard. Once per turn, during your turn: You can Special Summon 1 "Timelord" monster from your hand. Once per turn, during your opponent's turn: You can discard 1 "Timelord" monster; draw 2 cards. If this face-up card on the field is sent to the Graveyard: Target 1 "Nonexistence" in your Graveyard; add it to your hand.
texts.str1: Activate the effect of "Infinite Machine Ain Soph"?

texts.name: Infinite Light (VG)
texts.desc: Activate this card by sending 1 face-up "Infinite Machine" from your Spell & Trap Zone to the Graveyard. "Timelord" monsters you control cannot be returned to the Deck. Once per turn, during your turn: You can Special Summon 1 "Timelord" monster from your hand. Once per turn, during your opponent's turn: You can discard 1 "Timelord" monster; draw 2 cards. When this face-up card on the field is sent to the Graveyard: You can Special Summon 1 "Sephylon, the Ultimate Timelord" from your hand, Deck, or Graveyard, ignoring its Summoning conditions.
texts.str1: Activate the effect of "Infinite Light Ain Soph Ohr"?

texts.name: Sadion, the Timelord (VG)
texts.desc: Cannot be Special Summoned from the Deck. If you control no monsters, you can Normal Summon this card without Tributing. Cannot be destroyed by battle or by card effects. At the end of the Battle Phase, if this card attacked or was attacked, and your LP are lower than 4000: Your LP become 4000. During your Standby Phase: Shuffle this face-up card into the Deck.
texts.str2: This card returns to the deck

texts.name: Afterglow (VG)
texts.desc: Shuffle this card into the Deck. During your next Draw Phase, reveal the card you draw for your normal draw, and inflict 8000 damage to your opponent if it is "Afterglow".

texts.name: Empress's Staff
texts.desc: When an opponent's monster declares an attack: Negate the attack, then, inflict 500 damage to your opponent. If you control no monsters, you can activate this card from your hand.

texts.name: Satellite Laser Balsam
texts.desc:
"Satellite Cannon" + "Satellite Cannon" + "Satellite Cannon"
Must be Fusion Summoned, and cannot be Special Summoned by other ways. Once per turn, during your End Phase: This card gains 3000 ATK. After damage calculation, if this card attacks, the ATK gained by this effect returns to 0. If this card attacks a Defense Position monster, inflict piercing battle damage.

(This card is always treated as an "X" card.)

texts.name: Fossil Fusion (VG)

You can only control 1 "Meklord Emperor" monster.

texts.desc: If there is no "Meklord Emperor" monster on the field, destroy this card.

texts.str1: Use the effect of "Meklord Emperor Creation" to avoid destruction?

texts.name: Dark Summoning Beast (VG)

If a "Load of Darkness" on the field is destroyed, destroy all "Load of Darkness Tokens" on the field.

texts.name: Load of Darkness
texts.desc: Cannot be destroyed by battle. Cannot attack directly. When this card destroys an opponent's monster by battle: Inflict 700 damage to your opponent.

texts.name: Load of Darkness Token

For every monster this card destroys by battle, inflict 700 points of damage to your opponent's LP. (Damage calculation is applied normally.) If "Load of Darkness" is destroyed, destroy this Token.

texts.name: Illusion Gate
texts.desc: Destroy all monsters that your opponent controls, then, Special Summon 1 monster from your opponent's Graveyard to your side of the field, ignoring its Summoning conditions. Once per turn, during the End Phase, you lose 90 percent of your LP.

texts.desc: Once per turn, if the turn player controls a "Uria, Lord of Searing Flames", "Hamon, Lord of Striking Thunder", or "Raviel, Lord of Phantasms": They can draw 2 cards.

texts.desc:
Remove this card from the Duel immediately, and if you do, if all cards you now own compose an invalid Deck, your opponent can make you lose the Duel. Otherwise, draw 1 card if this card was in your hand. If both players agree, apply the following rules.
 At the start of the Duel, both players decide which Field Spell they want to use for the rest of this Turbo Duel, then activate the chosen Field Spell on both players' side of the field. If the chosen Field Spell is from Anime, its effect that places Speed Counters during the Standby Phase cannot be activated during the first turn of the Duel.
 Field Spells on the field cannot be targeted, chosen, counted, or destroyed by other card effects, and are unaffected by other card effects that would make them leave the field, also their effects cannot be negated. Neither player can activate a new Field Spell Card.
texts.str1: Do you want to pick the Field Spell for this Turbo Duel?
texts.str2: Pick the Field Spell for this Turbo Duel
texts.str3: Both players have picked a Field Spell, the one to be used will be decided in rock-paper-scissors
texts.str4: Neither player has picked a Field Spell, it will be generated automatically

texts.name: The Winged Dragon of Ra (VG)
texts.desc:
Requires 3 Tributes to Normal Summon (cannot be Normal Set). This card's Normal Summon cannot be negated. When this card is Normal Summoned, cards and effects cannot be activated. During the End Phase, if this card was Special Summoned: Send it to the Graveyard. This card's ATK/DEF are equal to the combined ATK/DEF of the Tributes. Cannot be targeted by card effects. When this card is Special Summoned: You can activate 1 of the following effects.
 Pay 1000 LP, then target 1 other monster on the field; destroy it and banish it instead of sending it to the Graveyard.
 Pay all your LP until you have 1 left; this card gains ATK/DEF equal to the amount paid.

texts.str3: Pay all but 1 Life Points, and increase ATK and DEF by the amount of Life Points paid.

texts.name: Quiz Action - Math for 100
texts.desc:
Answer the following question. Apply the appropriate effect, based on the answer. 
(Question: If you make 1 pillar for every 10 meters, how many pillars do you need for 100 meters?)
 Correct answer: Gain 100 LP.
 Incorrect answer: You take 100 damage.
texts.str1: Question: If you make 1 pillar for every 10 meters, how many pillars do you need for 100 meters? Answer: 7
texts.str2: Question: If you make 1 pillar for every 10 meters, how many pillars do you need for 100 meters? Answer: 10
texts.str3: Question: If you make 1 pillar for every 10 meters, how many pillars do you need for 100 meters? Answer: 100
texts.str4: Question: If you make 1 pillar for every 10 meters, how many pillars do you need for 100 meters? Answer: 40

texts.name: Quiz Action - Math for 200
texts.desc:
Answer the following question. Apply the appropriate effect, based on the answer. 
(Question: You roll a six on your first die, what is the probability to roll a six on your second die?)
 Correct answer: Gain 200 LP.
 Incorrect answer: You take 200 damage.
texts.str1: Question: You roll a six on your first die, what is the probability to roll a six on your second  die? Answer: 20%
texts.str2: Question: You roll a six on your first die, what is the probability to roll a six on your second  die? Answer: 35%
texts.str3: Question: You roll a six on your first die, what is the probability to roll a six on your second  die? Answer: 50%
texts.str4: Question: You roll a six on your first die, what is the probability to roll a six on your second  die? Answer: 33%

texts.name: Quiz Action - Math 5000
texts.desc:
Answer the following problem. Apply the appropriate effect, based on the answer. 
(Problem: Prove Fermat's Last Theorem!) 
Andrew Wiles tried to prove that the Theorem by Pierre de Fermat states that given the equation a^n + b^n = c^n for any n greater or equal 3, it is impossible for a, b and c to all be integers.Unfortunately the proof is after 7 years and few Decades with other mathematicians uncompleted. And even if you memorize the entire proof of Andrew Wiles and others you must write down 100 pages and to be a specialist to read and understand it.So toss a coin if the result is right you gain 5000 LP if wrong you take 1000 damage.

texts.name: Quiz Action - Science for 100
texts.desc:
Answer the following question. Apply the appropriate effect, based on the answer. 
(Question: There is an ice cube in a cup full of water. When the ice cube melts, will the water overflow the cup?)
 Correct answer: You take no battle damage, also you gain 100 LP.
 Incorrect answer: You take 100 damage.
texts.str1: Question: There is an ice cube in a cup full of water. When the ice cube melts, will the water  overflow the cup? Answer: No
texts.str2: Question: There is an ice cube in a cup full of water. When the ice cube melts, will the water  overflow the cup? Answer: Yes

texts.name: Quiz Action - Science for 300
texts.desc:
Answer the following question. Apply the appropriate effect, based on the answer. 
(Question: 300kg of iron or 300kg of cotton, which is heavier?)
 Correct answer: Gain 300 LP.
 Incorrect answer: You take 300 damage.

texts.name: Action Field Functions
texts.desc:
All Action Field basic functions
- At the start of the Duel, activate this card on both player's side of the field.
- This card cannot leave the field, except by activating a Field Spell. If this card would leave the field, remove it from the Duel instead.
- If there is no Field Spell in the Field Zone, place this card in the Field Zone from outside the Duel.
- During either player's turn, you can activate Action Cards from your hand.
- For the rest of this Duel, a Field Spell(s) in the Field Zone gains this effect.
 If you have no Action Cards in your hand (Quick Effect): You can activate this effect; if your opponent also has no Action Cards in their hand, they can play rock-paper-scissors with you. Add 1 random Action Card from outside the Duel to winning player's hand. Also, after that, both players toss a coin. If a player's result is tails, they cannot activate this effect for the rest of this turn. If your opponent did not play rock-paper-scissors with you, toss a coin. If the result is heads, add 1 random Action Card from outside the Duel to your hand. Also, after that, toss a coin. If the result is tails, you cannot activate this effect for the rest of this turn.
texts.str2: Do you want to fight for a Action Card?
texts.str3: You cannot find another Action Card for the rest of this turn
texts.str4: Do you want to pick the Action Field for this Duel?
texts.str5: Choose the Action Field for this Duel
texts.str6: Neither player picked an Action Field, one of you must make a choice!
texts.str7: You both picked an Action Field, this coin will decide the one to be used

texts.name: Action Field Generator
texts.desc:
Remove this card from the Duel immediately, and if you do, if all cards you now own compose an invalid Deck, your opponent can make you lose the Duel. Otherwise, draw 1 card if this card was in your hand. If both players agree, apply the following rules.
 At the start of the Duel, both players decide which Action Field they want to use for the rest of this Duel. If both players choose an Action Field, a coin will be tossed to decide whose Action Field to be used. Then activate the chosen Action Field on both player's side of the field
 Action Field cannot leave the field, except by activating a Field Spell. If it would leave the field, remove it from the Duel instead.
 If there is no Field Spell in the Field Zone, place the Action Field in the Field Zone from outside the Duel.
 Action Cards can be activated from the hands during either player's turn.
 For the rest of this Duel, a Field Spell(s) in the Field Zone gains this effect.
 - If you have no Action Cards in your hand, you can apply this effect. If your opponent also has no Action Cards in their hand, they can play rock-paper-scissors with you. Add 1 random Action Card from outside the Duel to winning player's hand. If your opponent did not play rock-paper-scissors with you, there is a 50% chance to add 1 random Action Card from outside the Duel to your hand. Any players who was involved in this effect have a 50% chance to become unable to apply this effect for the rest of this turn.

texts.name: Kaiser Eagle, the Heavens' Mandate
texts.desc:
3+ Winged Beast Effect Monsters
Must be Link Summoned. If this Extra Linked card attacks your opponent directly and reduces their LP to 0, you win the Match.

texts.name: Skyfaring Castle of the Black Forest
texts.desc:
3+ Rock Effect Monsters
Must be Link Summoned. If this Extra Linked card attacks your opponent directly and reduces their LP to 0, you win the Match.

texts.name: Legion the Fiend Jester (VG)
texts.desc: A magician on the dark side in the guise of a jester. It bobs and weaves to avoid attacks, then strikes sharply.

texts.name: Spark Breaker
texts.desc: Once per turn: You can target 1 monster you control; destroy that target.

texts.name: Floral Shield
texts.desc: When an opponent's monster declares an attack: Target the attacking monster; negate the attack, and if you do, draw 1 card.

texts.name: Zero Sprite
texts.desc: Target 1 face-up monster you control: equip this card to that target. The equipped monster's original ATK becomes 0, but it can attack twice during each Battle Phase.

texts.name: Twin Vortex
texts.desc: Target 1 Machine-Type monster you control and 1 monster your opponent controls; Destroy them.

texts.name: Toy Soldier
texts.desc: Once per turn, during your Standby Phase: You can Special Summon 1 "Toy Soldier" from your Deck in Attack Position.

texts.name: Toy Emperor
texts.desc: When this card destroys an opponent's monster by battle: You can add 1 Trap from your Deck to your hand.

texts.name: Crowning of the Emperor
texts.desc: Tribute 1 "Toy Soldier"; Special Summon 1 "Toy Emperor" from your hand or Deck.

texts.name: Hook the Hidden Knight
texts.desc: When this face-up Attack Position card is targeted for an attack: Change this card and the attacking monster to Defense Position. If this card is changed from Attack Position to Defense Position: Inflict 800 damage to your opponent.
texts.str1: Change Battle Position and inflict damage

texts.name: Archfiend Matador
texts.desc:
You can Ritual Summon this card with "Ritual of the Matador". Cannot attack. Cannot be destroyed by battle. You take no battle damage from battles involving this card. At the end of the Damage Step, if this card battles: Destroy the monster it battled.

(This card is always treated as an "Doll" card.)

texts.name: Ritual of the Matador
texts.desc:
This card is used to Ritual Summon "Archfiend Matador". You must also Tribute monsters from your hand or field whose total Levels equal 6 or more.

(This card is always treated as an "Doll" card.)

texts.name: Kiteroid
texts.desc: During damage calculation, if your opponent's monster attacks directly (Quick Effect): You can discard this card; you take no battle damage from that battle. During damage calculation, if your opponent's monster attacks directly (Quick Effect): You can banish this card from your Graveyard; you take no battle damage from that battle.

texts.name: Fenrir the Nordic Wolf (VG)
texts.desc: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must be Special Summoned (from your hand) to your opponent's side of the field in Defense Position, and cannot be Special Summoned by other ways. You cannot Normal Summon/Set or conduct your Battle Phase the turn you Special Summon this card. If there is no other "Nordic" or "Aesir" monsters on the field, destroy this card. Both players take battle damage from attacks involving this card. During each Standby Phase: Change the battle position of all monsters you control.

texts.name: Jormungardr the Nordic Serpent (VG)
texts.desc: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must first be Special Summoned (from your hand) to your opponent's side of the field in Defense Position. You cannot Normal Summon/Set the turn you Special Summon this card. When this Defense Position card is changed to Attack Position: Take 3000 damage. Cannot be used as a Synchro Material for a Summon. While this card is face-up on the field, it cannot be Tributed.

texts.name: Gatling Ogre
texts.desc: You can send 1 face-down card from your Spell & Trap Zone to the Graveyard; inflict 800 damage to your opponent.
texts.str1: Send face-down card and inflict 800 Damage

texts.name: Basara
texts.desc: Once per turn: You can Tribute 1 monster, then target 1 monster on the field whose Level is higher than the Tributed monster's; destroy it, and if you do, inflict 800 damage to its controller.

texts.name: Gate Defender
texts.desc: Once per turn, when an opponent's monster declares an attack: You can negate that attack. While you control another monster, your opponent cannot target this card for attacks. If a monster you control is destroyed by battle: Destroy this face-up card.

texts.name: Dark Arena
texts.desc: Both players choose their opponent's target for an attack. Monsters on the field must attack, if able.

texts.name: Fleur de Vertiges
texts.desc: When a monster(s) is Special Summoned to your opponent's side of the field while there is a face-up Field Spell on the field: Banish 1 of those monsters.

texts.name: Shield Recovery
texts.desc: Target 1 "B.E.S." monster you control; place 3 counters on it.

texts.name: Burst Impact
texts.desc: If you control an "Elemental Hero Burstinatrix": Destroy all cards on the field, except "Elemental Hero Burstinatrix", and if you do, players take damage equal to the number of monsters they controlled that were destroyed x300.

texts.name: Suit of Sword X
texts.desc:
Toss a coin and apply the following effect.
 Heads: Destroy all monsters your opponent controls.
 Tails: Destroy all monsters you control.

texts.name: Superficial Peace
texts.desc: During this turn, monsters cannot be destroyed by battle, also, if a monster you control inflicts battle damage to your opponent: Target 1 Spell/Trap your opponent controls; destroy it.

texts.name: White Veil (VG)
texts.desc: If the equipped monster attacks, negate the effects of all Spells/Traps your opponent controls until the end of the Damage Step. If the equipped monster is destroyed and this card is sent to the Graveyard: Take damage equal to the equipped monster's ATK.
texts.str1: Take Damage equal to its ATK

texts.name: Tuning Collapse
texts.desc: When a Synchro Monster(s) your opponent controls is destroyed by battle or card effect and sent to the Graveyard: Target 1 of those monsters; send a number of cards from the top of your opponent's Deck to the Graveyard equal to the Level of that target.

texts.name: Jester Queen
texts.desc: If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: Destroy all cards in your Spell & Trap Zone. If you control no other monsters, for each card in your Spell & Trap Zone, this card gains 1 additional attack during each Battle Phase.

texts.name: Defender's Mind
texts.desc: Activate only during the Main Phase. Change all face-up monsters you control to Defense Position. Double the DEF of all Defense Position monsters you control. You cannot change these monsters to Attack Position. You can only control 1 face-up "Defender's Mind".

texts.name: Labyrinth of Kline
texts.desc: When an opponent's monster declares an attack: Target the attacking monster; negate the attack, and if you do, switch the original ATK and DEF of that monster until the end of the next turn.

texts.name: Chain Close
texts.desc:
When a card(s) on the field is destroyed by battle or card effect and sent to the Graveyard: Your opponent cannot activate Spell/Trap Cards this turn. Neither player can activate cards or effects in response to this card's activation.

(This card is always treated as a "Rose" card.)

texts.name: Empress's Crown
texts.desc: If you control a "Timelord" monster: Draw 2 cards for each Synchro Monster your opponent controls. When a Synchro Monster is Special Summoned to your opponent's side of the field, you can activate this card from your hand.

texts.name: Power Converter
texts.desc: Equip only to a monster you control. Once per turn, during your Main Phase 1: You can gain LP equal to half the ATK of that monster by reducing its ATK to 0 until the End Phase.

texts.name: For Our Dreams
texts.desc: Tribute 1 Warrior-Type monster, then target 1 Warrior-Type monster you control; It cannot be destroyed by battle.

texts.name: Diving Exploder
texts.desc: (Quick Effect): You can send this card from your hand to the Graveyard; switch the original ATK/DEF of all monsters currently on the field, until the End Phase.

texts.name: Antidote Nurse
texts.desc:
3 Level 3 monsters
If this card battles an opponent's monster, that monster's ATK becomes its original ATK, during damage calculation only. Once per turn, during the Damage Step, when a monster you control attacking or being attacked (Quick Effect): You can detach 1 Xyz Material from this card; that monster gains 1000 ATK, until the End Phase.

texts.name: Infernity Des Gunman
texts.desc:
When your opponent activates a card or effect that would inflict damage while you have no cards in your hand: You can banish this card in your Graveyard; you take no damage from that effect. Your opponent chooses whether or not to apply the following effect:
 Excavate the top card of your Deck. If it is a monster, you take 2000 damage. If it is a Spell/Trap, inflict 2000 damage to your opponent, then shuffle your Deck.

texts.name: Jurassic Impact (VG)
texts.desc: If your LP is lower than your opponent's: Destroy all monsters on the field, and if you do, inflict 300 damage to each player for each monster they controlled that was destroyed by this effect. Neither player can Normal or Special Summon until the end of your next turn.

texts.name: Pride Shout
texts.desc: At the end of the Damage Step, if your monster with 0 ATK attacked directly while this card was already face-up in your Spell & Trap Zone: Inflict damage to your opponent equal to the DEF of that monster you control.

texts.name: Dogking
texts.desc: The equipped monster gains 500 ATK for each Beast-Type monster you control. If this card is sent to the Graveyard: You can add 1 "Tribulldog" from your Deck to your hand.
texts.str1: Add 1 "Tribulldog" from your Deck to your hand

texts.name: Synchro Monument
texts.desc: Synchro Summons cannot be negated. Neither player can activate any Spell/Trap Cards when a monster is Synchro Summoned.

texts.name: Absurd Stealer
texts.desc: If this card is Normal Summoned: Target 1 Attack Position Level 4 or lower monster your opponent controls; its ATK is halved, and if you do, this card's ATK becomes equal to the DEF of the targeted monster until the End Phase.

texts.name: Playmaker
texts.desc:
3 Level 5 monsters
If this card is Special Summoned: Change all face-down Defense Position monsters on the field to face-up Attack Position. (Flip Effects are not activated.) At the end of the Damage Step, if this card attacks a monster: You can detach 1 Xyz Material from this card, then target 1 monster your opponent controls with the highest ATK (your choice, if tied); this card can make a second attack in a row against that target.

texts.name: Dark Matter Token
texts.desc: Summoned by the effect of "Dark Matter". This Token cannot be destroyed by battle. Destroy this during the End Phase.

texts.name: Dark Matter
texts.desc: When a DARK Synchro Monster is destroyed by battle or card effect: Special Summon 2 "Dark Matter Tokens" (Fiend-Type/DARK/Level 1/ATK 0/DEF 0) to your side of the field in face-up Defense Position. These Tokens cannot be destroyed by battle, but destroy them during the End Phase.

texts.name: Imitation
texts.desc: Target 1 Token on the field; Special Summon 1 "Mask Token" with the same original Level, Type, Attribute, ATK and DEF as that Token to your opponent's side of the field, then, inflict damage to your opponent equal to half the ATK of the targeted Token.

texts.name: The Rival's Name
texts.desc: Target 1 monster in your opponent's Graveyard; Special Summon this card in Defense Position and it is treated as a Normal Monster (Spellcaster-Type/LIGHT/Level 1/ATK 0/DEF 0), whose name is treated as the targeted monster's name. (This card is also still a Spell.)

texts.name: Amphibian Angel - Frog-Hael
texts.desc: You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by Tributing 2 monsters you control. When you do: You can Special Summon as many "Frog" monsters as possible from your Graveyard. While you control another card, your opponent cannot target this card for attacks.
texts.str1: Special Summon as many "Frog" monsters as possible from your Graveyard

texts.name: Chariot Pile
texts.desc: Once per turn, during your Main Phase: You can inflict 300 damage to your opponent. Once per turn, if your opponent declares a direct attack: You can pay 800 LP; destroy the attacking monster.

texts.name: Thousand Crisscross
texts.desc: While your LP is less than 2000: You can make your LP become 2000. After this effect is used 3 times, destroy this card.

texts.name: Central Shield
texts.desc: Equip only to a monster you control. You take no battle damage from attacks involving a monster you control, other than the equipped monster.

texts.name: Late Penalty
texts.desc: At the start of your opponent's Standby Phase, if you control a Level 2 or lower Spellcaster-Type monster and your opponent controls no monsters: Skip your opponent's Battle Phase this turn.

texts.name: Divergence
texts.desc: Once per Chain, when an opponent's monster declares an attack that targets your Machine-Type monster: You can target 1 other Machine-Type monster you control; change the attack target to that target.

texts.name: Pain to Power
texts.desc: If a monster you control other than the equipped monster attacks and you take battle damage: The equipped monster gains ATK equal to the damage you took until the end of this turn.

texts.name: Synchro Back
texts.desc: Target 1 Synchro Monster you control; return that target to the Extra Deck, also during the Standby Phase of your next turn, Special Summon from your Extra Deck, 1 Synchro Monster with the same name as that monster returned to the Extra Deck.

texts.name: Climactic Barricade
texts.desc: When your opponent Normal Summons a monster: Level 4 or lower monsters your opponent controls cannot declare an attack during this turn, also, during this turn's End Phase, inflict 500 damage to your opponent for each Level 4 or lower monster your opponent controls.

texts.name: Ferocious Flora
texts.desc: Once per turn, during damage calculation, if a Plant-Type monster you control battles an opponent's monster (Quick Effect): That opponent's monster loses 800 ATK until the End Phase.

texts.name: Double Ripple
texts.desc: Send 2 face-up monsters you control to the Graveyard (1 Tuner and 1 non-Tuner), whose total Levels equal 7, then Special Summon both 1 "Power Tool Dragon" and 1 "Ancient Fairy Dragon" in Defense Position from your Extra Deck.

texts.name: Final Penalty
texts.desc: When a Fiend-Type monster you control is destroyed by an opponent's attacking monster and sent to the Graveyard: Inflict damage to your opponent equal to that monster's ATK, then, destroy the attacking monster.

texts.name: Hidden Passage
texts.desc: All Level 2 or lower Spellcaster-Type monsters you control with ATK lower than the face-up monster your opponent controls with the lowest ATK can attack your opponent directly.

texts.name: Gjallarhorn
texts.desc: Must be activated in the Graveyard. If this card is in your Graveyard: You can target 1 "Aesir" monster you control; that face-up monster is unaffected by the effects of other Spells/Traps this turn, also, after that, place this card face-up in your Spell & Trap Zone. During your 3rd End Phase after activation, inflict damage to your opponent equal to the total ATK of all monsters you control, and if you do, banish this card and all monsters you control.

texts.name: The Unselected One
texts.desc: While your opponent controls 2 or more monsters: Your opponent chooses 1 monster they control, and if they do, destroy 1 other monster they control, then, Special Summon that monster from your opponent's Graveyard in Attack Position, also, you cannot conduct your Battle Phase for the rest of this turn.

texts.name: Double Type Rescue
texts.desc: If you control 2 or more Types of monsters that are face-up, and your opponent controls more monsters than you do: Target 1 monster in your Graveyard; Special Summon it.

texts.name: Slash Draw (VG)
texts.desc: Discard 1 card; send cards from the top of your Deck to the GY, equal to the number of cards on the field, then, draw 1 card and reveal it. If it was "Slash Draw", send it to the Graveyard, and if you do, destroy as many cards on the field as possible, and if you do, inflict 1000 damage to your opponent for each card destroyed and sent to the GY by this effect.

texts.name: High and Low
texts.desc:
When your face-up monster is targeted for an attack: Apply the following effect up to 3 times while you control that face-up attack target.
Send the top card of your Deck to the Graveyard, and if it is a monster, the attack target gains ATK equal to the ATK of the monster you sent to the Graveyard, but if the attack target's ATK is higher than the attacking monster's ATK, destroy the attack target.

texts.name: Jester's Panic
texts.desc: Target 1 Set card in your opponent's Spell & Trap Zone; look at that target, then you can reveal 1 card from your hand of the same type (Spell or Trap), destroy that target, and if you do, all Level 2 or lower Spellcaster-Type monsters you currently control can attack your opponent directly this turn.

texts.name: Endless Loan
texts.desc: If your opponent Normal or Special Summons a monster, except a "Loan Token": Activate this effect for each of those monsters; Special Summon 1 "Loan Token" (Rock-Type/LIGHT/Level 1/ATK 0/DEF 0) to your opponent's side of the field in Defense Position, but it cannot be Tributed or be used as a Synchro Material. During your opponent's Main Phase: Your opponent can send 1 card from their hand to the Graveyard, then target 1 "Loan Token" on the field; destroy it.

texts.name: Loan Token
texts.desc:
This card can be used as a "Loan Token".

*If used for another Token, apply that Token's Type/Attribute/Level/ATK/DEF.

texts.name: Toichi the Nefarious Debt Collector
texts.desc:
Once per turn: You can inflict 1000 damage to your opponent for each "Loan Token" on the field. Cannot be destroyed by battle while there is a "Loan Token" on the field. You can only control 1 face-up "Toichi the Nefarious Debt Collector".

(This card is always treated as an "Earth" and "Toy" card.)

texts.name: Wiretap (VG)
texts.desc: When your opponent activates a Trap Card: Negate its activation, and if you do, shuffle that card face-up into your opponent's Deck. Until they draw that card, your opponent cannot activate cards with the same name.

texts.name: Terminal Countdown
texts.desc:
While this card is face-up on the field, you cannot activate Spell/Trap Cards. Once per turn, during your opponent's End Phase: You can choose 1 Spell/Trap in your Deck, reveal it to your opponent and set it in your Spell & Trap Zone. During your Main Phase: You can send this card and all Spells/Traps Set by this effect from your side of the field to the Graveyard; inflict an amount of damage to your opponent, depending on the number of cards sent.
 2: 500
 3: 1500
 4: 3000
 5: 6000

texts.name: T.G. Cyber Magician (VG)
texts.desc: Cannot be used as a Synchro Material, except for the Synchro Summon of a "T.G." monster. When using this card as a Synchro Material, the other Synchro Material is 1 monster in your hand. This card is also treated as a Machine-Type monster. When this card on the field is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: You can add 1 "T.G. Cyber Magician" from your Deck to your hand.
texts.str1: Add 1 "T.G. Cyber Magician" to your hand

texts.name: T.G. Rush Rhino (VG)
texts.desc: If this card attacks, it gains 400 ATK during the Damage Step only. This card is also treated as a Machine-Type monster. When this card on the field is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: You can add 1 "T.G. Rush Rhino" from your Deck to your hand.

texts.name: T.G. Striker (VG)
texts.desc: If only your opponent controls a monster, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). This card is also treated as a Machine-Type monster. When this card on the field is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: You can add 1 "T.G. Striker" from your Deck to your hand.

texts.name: T.G. Warwolf (VG)
texts.desc: When you Special Summon a Level 2 or lower monster: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. This card is also treated as a Machine-Type monster. When this card on the field is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: You can add 1 "T.G. Warwolf" from your Deck to your hand.

texts.name: T.G. Blade Blaster (VG)
texts.desc:
1 Synchro Tuner + 1 non-Tuner Synchro Monster
When your opponent activates a Spell/Trap Card that targets this card: You can send 1 card from your hand to the Graveyard; negate its activation, and if you do, destroy it. When an opponent's monster declares an attack: You can banish this card. During the End Phase: Special Summon this card banished by this effect. When this card on the field is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: You can target 1 "T.G." Tuner monster in your Graveyard; Special Summon it.

texts.name: T.G. Power Gladiator (VG)
texts.desc:
1 "T.G." Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
If this card attacks a Defense Position monster, inflict piercing battle damage. This card is also treated as a Machine-Type monster. When this card on the field is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: You can add 1 "T.G." monster from your Deck to your hand.

texts.name: T.G. Wonder Magician (VG)
texts.desc:
1 Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner Monsters
Cannot be used as a Synchro Material, except for the Synchro Summon of a "T.G." monster. During your oppenent's Main Phase: You can Synchro Summon using this face-up card you control as a Synchro Material. This card is also treated as a Machine-Type monster. When this card on the field is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: You can add 1 "T.G." monster from your Deck to your hand.

texts.name: Attribute Gravity
texts.desc: All monsters on the field must attack monsters with the same Attributes as they do, if able.

texts.name: Cold Sleeper
texts.desc: When a monster you control is destroyed by battle and sent to the Graveyard: You can choose 1 of your unused Monster Zones; Special Summon the destroyed monster at the end of the Battle Phase, but it cannot change its battle position, also, the chosen Monster Zone cannot be used for the entire Duel.

texts.name: Illusion Ice Sculpture
texts.desc: If this card is Summoned: Target 1 monster you control; this card's ATK/DEF become equal to that monster's original ATK/DEF. Other monsters you control cannot be targeted for an attack. There can only be 1 face-up "Illusion Ice Sculpture" on the field.

texts.name: Snow Fairy
texts.desc:
Your opponent cannot activate Spell Cards from their hand, nor activate Spell Cards during the turn they are Set.

(This card is always treated as a "Pixie" card and it is never a "Fairy" card.)

texts.name: White Blizzard
texts.desc: If an opponent's monster is destroyed by battle: Inflict 600 damage to your opponent. When this card is destroyed: Target 1 card you control; destroy it.

texts.name: White Night Fort
texts.desc: Neither player can activate Trap Cards during their opponent's turn.

texts.name: Clear Sacrifice
texts.desc: Reveal 1 Level 5 or higher "Clear" monster in your hand, banish "Clear" monsters from your Graveyard equal to the number of monsters needed to Tribute Summon the revealed monster; You can Normal Summon that monster without Tributing this turn.

texts.name: Bounce Spell
texts.desc: Take control of a Spell your opponent controls, and apply its effect as though you activated it.

texts.name: Summoning Clock
texts.desc: Activate only when your opponent activates a Spell/Trap Card. Once per turn, during your Standby Phase, place 1 Turn Counter on this card. You can Tribute this card and 1 monster; Special Summon monsters from your hand equal to the number of Turn Counters that were on this card.

texts.name: Royal Straight
texts.desc: Tribute 1 "Queen's Knight", "King's Knight", and "Jack's Knight" in face-up Attack Position; Special Summon 1 "Royal Straight Slasher" from your hand, Deck, or Graveyard.

texts.name: Royal Straight Slasher
texts.desc: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must be Special Summoned with "Royal Straight", and cannot be Special Summoned by other ways. You can send 1 monster each of Levels 1 through 5 from your Deck to the Graveyard; destroy all cards your opponent controls.

texts.name: Ground Erosion
texts.desc: Once per turn, during your Standby Phase: Place 1 Turn Counter on this card. You can Tribute this card with a Turn Counter(s) on it, then choose 1 of your opponent's Monster Zones; a monster(s) in that Zone has its effects negated, also it loses ATK equal to the number of Turn Counters that were on this card x 500.

texts.name: Turn Jump (Anime)
texts.desc: During the Battle Phase: Make each player end their next respective 3 turns and resume the Duel at that player's Battle Phase.

texts.name: Blue Expense Falcon
texts.desc: When this card is Normal Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 Level 4 or lower Dragon-Type monster from your hand. Cannot be used as a Synchro Material, except for the Synchro Summon of a WIND monster.

texts.name: Speed Spell - Defense Buster
texts.desc: While you have 2 or more Speed Counters: Target 1 Defense Position monster on the field; change it to face-up Attack Position.

texts.name: Star Gatherer
texts.desc: Target 1 Synchro Monster your opponent controls; this card's Level becomes equal to the Level of that monster -1.

texts.name: Break Tune
texts.desc: When an opponent's monster declares an attack: Special Summon 1 Tuner from your hand, then, negate the attack.

texts.name: Triangle Warrior
texts.desc: You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by Special Summoning 2 "Triangle Tokens" (Warrior-Type/LIGHT/Level 2/ATK 1200/DEF 1200) to your opponents side of the field in Defense Position.

texts.name: Triangle Token
texts.desc: Special Summon with the effect of "Triangle Warrior".

texts.name: Double Tribute
texts.desc: When a monster is Normal or Special Summoned to your side of the field: Destroy that monster and 1 monster your opponent controls.

texts.name: Level Cannon
texts.desc: If a monster is Summoned: Its controller takes damage equal to its Level x200.

texts.name: Tomatoknight
texts.desc: If this card is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard: Special Summon 1 "Tomatoknight" from your Deck.

texts.name: Tomato Paradise
texts.desc: All Plant-Type monsters you control gain 200 ATK for each Plant-Type monster you control. When a player Normal or Special Summons a Plant-Type monster from their hand: They can Special Summon 1 "Tomato Token" (Plant-Type/EARTH/Level 1/ATK 0/DEF 0) to their side of the field.

texts.name: Tomato Token
texts.desc: Special Summoned by the effect of "Tomato Paradise".

texts.name: Tomatopult
texts.desc: You can Tribute 1 Plant-Type monster you control; inflict 400 damage to your opponent.

texts.name: Tough Tomato
texts.desc: All Plant-Type monster you currently control gain 500 ATK until the End Phase of your next turn.

texts.name: Beetron-1 Beetletop
texts.desc: A mechanized bug that crushes everything that stands in his way.

texts.name: Beetron-2 Beetleturbo
texts.desc: Once per turn, you can either: Target 1 "Beetron-1 Beetron" you control; equip this card to that target, OR: Unequip this card and Special Summon it in face-up Attack Position. While equipped by this effect, the equipped monster gains 400 ATK/DEF. (A monster can only be equipped with 1 Union monster at a time. If the equipped monster would be destroyed, destroy this card instead.)

texts.name: Beetron-3 Spider Base
texts.desc: Once per turn, you can either: Target 1 "Beetron-1 Beetron" you control; equip this card to that target, OR: Unequip this card and Special Summon it in face-up Attack Position. While equipped by this effect, the equipped monster gains 600 ATK/DEF. (A monster can only be equipped with 1 Union monster at a time. If the equipped monster would be destroyed, destroy this card instead.)

texts.name: Assault Cannon Beetle
texts.desc:
"Beetron-1 Beetletop" + "Beetron-2 Beetleturbo" + "Beetron-3 Spider Base"
Must first be Special Summoned (from your Extra Deck) by returning the above cards you control to the Deck. (You do not use "Polymerization".) You can Tribute 1 monster; inflict 800 damage to your opponent.

texts.name: Combat Scissors Beetle
texts.desc: Must be Special Summoned with "Front Change", and cannot be Special Summoned by other ways. When this card destroys a monster by battle and sends it to the Graveyard: inflict 1000 damage to your opponent.

texts.name: Front Change
texts.desc:
Apply 1 of the following effects.
 Tribute 1 "Assault Cannon Beetle"; Special Summon 1 "Combat Scissor Beetle" from your Extra Deck.
 Tribute 1 "Combat Scissor Beetle"; Special Summon 1 "Assault Cannon Beetle" from your Extra Deck, ignoring its Summoning conditions.

texts.name: Spirit Shield
texts.desc: When an opponent's monster declares an attack: You can banish 1 Fiend or Zombie-Type monster from your Graveyard; negate that attack. If there are no Fiend or Zombie-Type monsters in your Graveyard, destroy this card.

texts.name: The Duke of Demise
texts.desc:
"Earl of Demise"+ "Headless Knight"
Cannot be destroyed by battle. Once per turn, during your Standby Phase, pay 500 LP or destroy this card.
